intro: Pimpinella rubescens, commonly known as the red-hairy parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, celery, and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or disturbed areas. Pimpinella rubescens is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
